A C D E F G I L M O P R S T U W

A

actionPerformed(ActionEvent) - Method in class com.ibm.mqttsample.utility.ConnOpts
ActionListener interface
Listen out for the following button events: Close button pressed - action: close the dialog Trace(Start) button pressed - action: Start trace and toggle the button to being the stop button Trace(Stop) button pressed - action: Stop the trace and toggle the button to being the start button Default button pressed - action: Reset all fields in the dialog to their default values
actionPerformed(ActionEvent) - Method in class com.ibm.mqttsample.utility.MQTTFrame
Implement the ActionListener interface and catch user interface events.
actionPerformed(ActionEvent) - Method in class com.ibm.mqttsample.utility.MQTTHist
ActionListener interface
Listen out for close and clear button events.
actionPerformed(ActionEvent) - Method in class com.ibm.mqttsample.utility.PubPanel
ActionListener interface
Listen out for the Publish button, the Hex/Text button being pressed or the File button being pressed
Publishing data involves:
Converting the data to a character representation if necessary from hex Updating the drop down boxes with the topic if necessary Publishing the data Converting the data back to a hex representation if necessary Writing a log entry
Processing the File button involves reading the file contents into a buffer ready for publishing.
actionPerformed(ActionEvent) - Method in class com.ibm.mqttsample.utility.SubPanel
ActionListener interface
Listen out for the Subscribe button, Unsubscribe button, Save button or the Hex/Text button being pressed
Subscribing / Unsubscribing for data involves:
Updating the drop down boxes with the topic if necessary Subscribing / Unsubscribing for the data
Processing the Save button involves poping up a file dialog, opening the file, writing the data and closing the file.
addReceivedMessage(int, byte[]) - Method in class com.ibm.mqttsample.persistence.MqttFilePersistence
Add a message that is has been received to the persistence store
addSentMessage(int, byte[]) - Method in class com.ibm.mqttsample.persistence.MqttFilePersistence
Add a message that is about to be sent to the persistence store

close() - Method in class com.ibm.mqttsample.persistence.MqttFilePersistence
There is nothing to do for close as we are using the file system, which it doesn't make sense to close
close() - Method in class com.ibm.mqttsample.utility.MQTTHist
Terminate the thread that autoscrolls the text.
com.ibm.mqttsample.midpapp - package com.ibm.mqttsample.midpapp
This package contains a J2ME MIDP-1.0 sample application.
com.ibm.mqttsample.persistence - package com.ibm.mqttsample.persistence
 
com.ibm.mqttsample.utility - package com.ibm.mqttsample.utility
This package contains a J2SE Swing user interface for WMQTT as a sample application.

connectionLost() - Method in class com.ibm.mqttsample.midpapp.Echo
 
connectionLost() - Method in class com.ibm.mqttsample.midpapp.WmqttMgr
Handle a broken MQTT connection.
This reconnects to the broker and resubscribes to the request topic in the event of the MQTT connection unexpectedly breaking.
connectionLost() - Method in class com.ibm.mqttsample.utility.MQTTFrame
The method is part of the MqttSimpleCallback interface
In the event of the WMQTT connection being broken the LED is set to colour amber and made to flash.
connectToBroker() - Method in class com.ibm.mqttsample.midpapp.WmqttMgr
Connect this MQTT client to the broker
ConnOpts - Class in com.ibm.mqttsample.utility
This class constructs the user interface dialog allowing the input of additional connect options as well as some usability options such as displaying a history of events and enabling persistence in the protocol.

constructPropertyValue(String) - Method in class com.ibm.mqttsample.utility.MQTTFrame
For a given property key construct a value to associate with the key The value can then be inserted in a properties object

Create the configuration panel.
createGaugePanel() - Method in class com.ibm.mqttsample.midpapp.Echo
Create a panel in which the continuously scrolling gauge may be displayed whilst the MIDlet is waiting for certain events to happen.
createLogPanel() - Method in class com.ibm.mqttsample.midpapp.Echo

E

Echo - Class in com.ibm.mqttsample.midpapp
Echo is a sample MQ Telemetry Transport application that can run in the J2ME MIDP environment.
The MIDlet will only work in a MIDP 1.0 environment if TCP/IP sockets are supported.
Echo() - Constructor for class com.ibm.mqttsample.midpapp.Echo
Echo zero argument constructor.
